Definition: Vaginal cancer is a rare type of cancer that occurs in the vaginal tissues.
Causes: Human papillomavirus (HPV) infection and other risk factors.
Symptoms: Abnormal vaginal bleeding, pain during intercourse, and a lump in the vagina.
Diagnosis: Pelvic examination, biopsy, and imaging studies.

Definition: A vaginal cyst is a fluid-filled sac that forms in the vaginal wall.
Causes: Blocked glands or ducts in the vaginal area.
Symptoms: Often asymptomatic; may cause discomfort or pain.
Treatment: Observation, drainage, or surgical removal if symptomatic.

Definition: Varicose veins are enlarged, twisted veins that often appear blue or dark purple.
Causes: Weak or damaged valves in the veins.
Symptoms: Aching, heaviness, and swelling in the legs.
Treatment: Compression stockings, lifestyle changes, and procedures like sclerotherapy.

Definition: Venous insufficiency is a condition in which the veins cannot pump enough blood back to the heart.
Causes: Weak or damaged valves in the veins.
Treatment: Compression therapy, lifestyle changes, and surgical options.

Definition: A ventricular septal defect is a congenital heart defect characterized by a hole in the wall separating the heart's lower chambers.
Causes: Genetic factors and environmental influences during pregnancy.
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, fatigue, and heart murmur.
Treatment: Monitoring, medications, and surgery if necessary.

Definition: Ventricular tachycardia is a fast heart rate that originates from the ventricles of the heart.
Causes: Heart disease, electrolyte imbalances, and certain medications.

Definition: A vertebral fracture is a break in one of the bones of the spine.
Causes: Trauma, osteoporosis, and certain medical conditions.
Symptoms: Back pain, limited mobility, and deformity.
Diagnosis: Imaging studies such as X-rays or MRI.
Treatment: Pain management, physical therapy, and surgery in severe cases.

Definition: Vertigo is a sensation of spinning or dizziness, often caused by inner ear problems.
Causes: Inner ear disorders, vestibular migraines, and neurological conditions.
Symptoms: Spinning sensation, balance issues, and nausea.
Treatment: Vestibular rehabilitation, medications, and lifestyle changes.

Definition: Vitiligo is a skin condition characterized by the loss of pigment, resulting in white patches on the skin.
Causes: Autoimmune response, genetic factors, and environmental triggers.
Symptoms: White patches on the skin, often more noticeable in darker skin.
Treatment: Topical treatments, light therapy, and cosmetic options.

Definition: Vocal cord lesions are abnormal growths or changes on the vocal cords that can affect voice quality.
Causes: Vocal strain, smoking, and acid reflux.
Symptoms: Hoarseness, voice fatigue, and difficulty speaking.
Treatment: Voice therapy, lifestyle changes, and surgery if necessary.

Definition: Vocal cord paralysis is a condition where one or both vocal cords cannot move properly.
Causes: Nerve damage, surgery, and neurological conditions.
Symptoms: Hoarseness, breathy voice, and difficulty swallowing.
Treatment: Voice therapy, surgery, and management of underlying causes.

Definition: Vocal cord strain is an injury to the vocal cords caused by overuse or misuse.
Treatment: Voice rest, hydration, and voice therapy.

Definition: Volkmann's ischemic contracture is a condition resulting from insufficient blood flow to the muscles of the forearm, leading to muscle and nerve damage.
Causes: Compartment syndrome, trauma, and prolonged pressure.
Symptoms: Pain, weakness, and deformity of the hand.
Treatment: Surgery, physical therapy, and management of underlying causes.

Definition: Von Willebrand disease is a genetic bleeding disorder caused by a deficiency of von Willebrand factor.
Symptoms: Easy bruising, frequent nosebleeds, and heavy menstrual bleeding.

Definition: Vulvar cancer is a type of cancer that occurs on the external female genitalia.
Causes: Human papillomavirus (HPV) infection and other risk factors.
Symptoms: Itching, pain, and abnormal growths on the vulva.
Diagnosis: Pelvic examination, biopsy, and imaging studies.
